title: Raj Pandit: It’s an experience I feel lucky to be getting at this stage and this age in my life
text:
He's the new kid on the block of Bollywood playback but an old hand at film music production and background scores. Singer Raj Pandit has assisted composer duo Salim-Sulaiman on the background scores of a string of films like Bang Bang, Krrish 3 and Race 2.
READ: Cast and crew of Wedding Pulao shoot in Delhi
Something of a child prodigy, he's been playing tabla and piano for years and has also worked with Raju Singh on film and television scores. His latest outing is as singer in upcoming film Wedding Pullav for ' O Jaaniya ' and ' Lagan lagi .' Says he, " Lagan Lagi is a heartbreak song that comes at a very important point just before the interval. We have done it in a very classic way, but with a little touch of the newer sound. It has a good balance of the new age Bollywood sound and the traditional."

Ask him about his association with Salim-Sulaiman, and he says, "It's an experience I feel lucky to be getting at this stage and this age in my life. It's incredible to be working and being on the other (technical) side of things, as well as recording and working with iconic singers. It's pretty amazing to have exposure to both sides of the singing field. When you're also a part of the production team and the technical side of things, it gives you additional perspective and you learn a lot more."

A student of Ustad Allah Rakha Khan's Institute of Music, he raves about the homely environment at the institute. "Whenever Zakir Hussain comes to Mumbai, he makes sure he always came to the class and gives us guidance." Ask the 21-year-old son of filmmaker Ashok Pandit and folk singer Neerja Pandit why he chose films over world music, he says that films have always been at the top of his list. "It's a good balance to bring out the classical folk music I've learnt into the film music I will do as a singer and maybe as a composer."
